div1.p: Blossom describes a fire at her house and offers her opinion on the Cuban response to her father.

div1.head: Letter from Blossom Reed to Philip Showalter Hench, January 17, 1953

opener.dateline:
Sat - Jan - 17 '53 MRS. BLOSSOM REED
BLUE RIDGE SUMMIT
PENNSYLVANIA

div1.p:
All your clippings
and wonderful letter
about Cuba came yesterday.
You are a wonder!
I got the little pictures
you sent - but did
not thank you for
them - because I
picked up a bug!!
The bug left and
then we had a
Ac
R
right bad fire here
at my home-Oh!
such a cold stormy
morning - Jan 10 - at 730
Thank God it was
not in the middle of
the night- We had a fearful ice & sleet
storm for three days-
Phone wires in the
yard - trees falling
and blocking the
roads- But we
have a wonderful
MRS. BLOSSOM REED
BLUE RIDGE SUMMIT
PENNSYLVANIA
Fire Dept - of young
men - here and at
Fort Ritchie and they
saved my home-
My electric lines pulled
off the house from
ice - caused a short
circuit and the wall
inside caught on fire-
After I hustled into
my clothes- I only
reached for 4 things-
The picture I've kept
before me of my
Ac
R
beloved father for over
now 50 years - Mothers
picture that I now
keep beside fathers'-
a silver cross I keep
in front of both - and
my beautiful Cat!
Off we went to
a neighbors house
and as every one
was so good to
me I got back that
night at 8.30 fixed
up with one light
down stairs - My
ice box & stove on -
MRS. BLOSSOM REED
BLUE RIDGE SUMMIT
PENNSYLVANIA
I have 6 paying guests-
One couple - & 4 men-
They have been good
as gold and refuse
to move- Now comes
the dirty work of paint
plaster etc - Now enough
of me - I was so
interested in all you
did in Cuba- Aren't
they something tho about
Yellow Fever- If I had
been there and they
could have understood
Ac
R
English- I would
most certainly have
said as I wrote-
"You know my
father discovered the
cause of Yellow Fever
and as does the
whole world know-
its true- I did not
write what I am
going to say, now-
that you cant stay
so _____ stupid! The
blank stands for damn-
I'm sure Miss Wood
was meak & polite
MRS. BLOSSOM REED
BLUE RIDGE SUMMIT
PENNSYLVANIA
so you all are
lucky I stayed at
home! and now
my love and all
good wishes to you
and your charming
family - and do
call me “Blossom”
